text: Bettina Popp (born 6 September 1957) is a German former track and field sprinter who competed in the 400 metres. Her personal best of 51.62 seconds was set in 1977.Bettina Popp. European Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-07-30. She represented East Germany and was a gold medallist in the 4 × 400 metres relay at the 1977 IAAF World Cup alongside Barbara Krug, Christina Lathan, and Marita Koch.Bettina Popp. All-Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-07-30.IAAF Statistics Book Split 2010. IAAF. Retrieved on 2016-07-30. She was a member of SC DHfK Leipzig sports club. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1957 births Category:German female sprinters Category:East German female sprinters
title: Bettina Popp
